title: Academy Awards Watch Parties
description: Various locations to watch the Oscars with different admission prices and perks.

title: The 26th St. Pat's for All Parade
description: The annual St. Pat's for All Parade returns to Sunnyside, Queens, led by grand marshals Judy Collins and Micky Murray.

title: Gotham Writers Workshop: Memoir Writing
description: An introductory workshop led by author Kyleigh Leddy at P+T Knitwear Bookstore (LES).

title: Bandai Namco Cross Store Opening
description: Level up your collection with Pac-Man, Tamagotchi, One Piece card game, and more as Japan's Bandai Namco opens its first U.S. store in Industry City's Japan Village.

title: ADIFF Black History Month Film Series
description: The African Diaspora International Film Festival presents three days of screenings at Teachers College, Columbia University (Morningside Heights), showcasing untold black stories.
address: Teachers College, Columbia University, Morningside Heights

title: 6th Annual Black Women in Comedy Laff Fest
description: This year's Black Women in Comedy Laff Fest returns during Black History Month and Women's History Month with 24 shows over 5 days at various locations.

title: 33rd Outsider Art Fair
description: The premier fair devoted to self-taught art, art brut, and outsider art returns to Metropolitan Pavilion (Chelsea) with more than 60 exhibitors from 40 cities across nine countries.
cost: $35 general admission, $25 senior + student tickets at the door

title: Tale Storytelling Show
description: An evening of performances by some of the city’s best storytellers, hosted by Harmon Leon at The Red Room at KGB Bar (East Village).
address: The Red Room at KGB Bar, East Village

title: Film on Tap: A Short Film Festival
description: Settle in for a night of suds and cinema at Bronx Brewery.

title: The Parlor Reading Series
description: The Parlor hosts its winter 2025 edition at the Brooklyn Artery (Flatbush/Ditmas Park).

title: Laugh It Off
description: Bring your problems to the Laugh It Off show, where comedians try to 'fix' them.

title: Sh*tty Mozart + Sh*tty Friends
description: A variety show and party with guest comedians and musicians at The Rat NYC (Williamsburg).

title: Bitches Brew Comedy Show
description: A women-produced and-hosted comedy show at Halyards (Gowanus).
cost: Free (tip jar will be passed around)

title: UCBlk: A Variety Show Spotlighting Black Performers
description: Join hosts for a night of improv, sketch, stand-up, music and more at UCB (East Village).

title: Myrtle Avenue Restaurant Week
description: 15 restaurants in Fort Greene & Clinton Hill, Brooklyn, offering exclusive 3-course dining deals at price points for every budget.

title: Regina Opera: Il Pagliacci
description: Brooklyn’s Regina Opera presents a fully-staged performance of Ruggero Leoncavallo’s Il Pagliacci at Our Lady of Perpetual Help Auditorium (Sunset Park).
address: Our Lady of Perpetual Help Auditorium, Sunset Park

title: Chase Away the Winter Blues Tour of Brooklyn Botanic Garden
description: An hour-long nature walk at Brooklyn Botanic Garden, led by licensed psychotherapist Lynne Spevack.
cost: Free with garden admission ($22 general, $16 seniors/students, free community tickets)

title: New York Winter Fungi Fest
description: A celebration of all things mushrooms at Farm.One, a hydroponic farm and brewery in Prospect Heights.

title: Uptown Record Fair
description: Shop jazz, rock, hip-hop, blues, experimental, and more at the second annual Uptown Record Fair, a fundraiser for Recirculation.

title: Comics + Caffeine Fest
description: Discover indie comics, zines, and art at the Comics + Caffeine Fest, where you can meet the artists and enjoy coffee, tea, and eats.

title: Tom D’s Big New York Show
description: A variety show about New York with comedian Tom Delgado, featuring guests and prizes.

title: Catch Performance Series
description: The Catch Performance Series returns to the Invisible Dog Art Center (Boerum Hill) with various artists.
address: Invisible Dog Art Center, Boerum Hill

title: Feel the News with Marcela Onyango
description: A variety comedy show with guests at Friends and Lovers (Crown Heights).

title: Paperclip
description: A one-man musical about Clippy, Microsoft’s failed virtual assistant, at The Rat NYC (Dumbo).

title: Peoples’ Symphony Concerts Classical Music Series: Juilliard String Quartet
description: The 125th season continues with a solo recital featuring works by Bach, Coleridge-Taylor Perkinson, Lang, and Ysaÿe at Washington Irving High School Auditorium (Gramercy).
address: Washington Irving High School Auditorium, Gramercy

title: Party Like It’s 1999: The Destiny of Beyoncé Edition
description: A dance party celebrating the anniversary of Destiny’s Child scoring their second number-one hit at The Bell House (Gowanus).

title: SKINT WEEKEND
description: New film series at Metrograph (LES) featuring various films including 'Take a Walk on the Wild Side' and 'The Body Between Us'.
